intro: Pleurospermum dochenense, commonly known as the Tibetan tansy, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, aromatic leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. It is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional Tibetan medicine. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an important species in its native habitat.
